question: Which one of the following is the highest produced silk type in India?
explanation: Mulberry with 79.1% share stands first in total production of silk in India followed by eri with 13.5%, tasar with 5.7% and raw silk with 0.6% share. India is the second largest producer of silk in the world and produces 18% of the world's total silk. China is the largest producer of silk.
